sen.j: 小鴨 元清（おがも もときよ）は、戦国時代 (日本)・安土桃山時代の武将で伯耆国久米郡岩倉城 (伯耆国)主。
sen.e: Motokiyo OGAMO was a Japanese military commander during the Sengoku period and Azuchi-momoyama period and the lord of Iwakura-jo Castle in Kume gunn, Hoki Province.

Motokiyo OGAMO was a Japanese busho (military commander) lived through the Sengoku period (period of warring states in Japan) to Azuchi-momoyama period, who became the lord of Iwakura-jo Castle in Kume Domain, Hoki Province.
sen.cmt: 他の訳例では通常「武将」は「busho」とし、括弧で説明を加える形になっていましたので、それにあわせ修正しました。久米郡が「Kume gunn」となっており規定に則っていませんので修正しました。
sen.e: Motokiyo OGAMO was a Japanese busho (military commander) lived through the Sengoku period (period of warring states in Japan) to Azuchi-momoyama period, who became the lord of Iwakura-jo Castle in Kume Domain, Hoki Province.

sen.j: 一部で羽衣石城主とする記述が見られるが、誤りである。
sen.e: Some reported him as the Lord of Ueshi-jo Castle but it was erroneous.
Some descriptions regarded him as the Lord of Ueshi-jo Castle, but it is incorrect.
sen.cmt: 「一部で～とする記述が見られるが」の訳が「some reported him as」となっています。訳の欠落と考え修正しました。現在において「誤り」と考えられている、という意味ですので、現在形に修正しました。
sen.e: Some descriptions regarded him as the Lord of Ueshi-jo Castle, but it is incorrect.

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 南条宗勝の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born to the second son to Munekatsu NANJO.
He was born as the second son of Munekatsu NANJO.
sen.cmt: 「second son」がない場合は「born to～」で正しいですが、この場合は間違いです。asに修正しました。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Munekatsu NANJO.

sen.j: 生年不詳である元清の初見は永禄5年（1562年）11月、松尾神社に神田75石を寄進したのが初めである。
sen.e: Motokiyo with his birth date unknown made his first appearance in 1562 when he donated 75 koku kanda (fields owned by shrines) to Matsuo Shrine.
While the birth date of Motokiyo is unknown, he made his first appearance in a record in 1562 that he donated kanda (fields owned by shrines) in 75 koku to Matsuo-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 「Motokiyo with his birth date unknown made～」とこのフレーズを主語形態にしていますが、かなり強引だと思われます。修正しました。松尾神社の訳を規定に合わせ修正しました。
sen.e: While the birth date of Motokiyo is unknown, he made his first appearance in a record in 1562 that he donated kanda (fields owned by shrines) in 75 koku to Matsuo-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: その後、永禄から天正年間にかけて小鴨氏の家督を継ぎ、小鴨姓を名乗った。
sen.e: After that, he made the announcement of his surname as Ogamo after taking over the reigns of the Ogamo family estate.
During the periods of Eiroku to Tensho era, he succeeded the headship of the Ogamo family and changed his surname to Ogamo.
sen.cmt: 「永禄から天正年間にかけて」の部分が訳において欠落しています。追加しました。家督を「reigns～family estate」の訳としていますが、「headship of family」に修正しました。
sen.e: During the periods of Eiroku to Tensho era, he succeeded the headship of the Ogamo family and changed his surname to Ogamo.

sen.j: 天正7年（1579年）に南条氏が織田氏の下へ離反し、翌天正8年（1580年）に吉川元春が伯耆へ侵出した際には兄の元続とともに八橋城を2波に渡って攻撃するも敗退した。
sen.e: In 1579, when the Nanjo clan broke away to the Odan clan, he and his brother Mototsugu were defeated after two waves of attacks on Yabase castle when Motoharu KIKKAWA invaded the Hoki province.

In 1579, the Nanjo clan broke away from the Mori clan to the Oda clan, then Motoharu KIKKAWA (Motoharu MORI) opposed this action and invaded the Hoki province; although Motokiyo and his elder brother Mototsugu attacked Yabase-jo Castle of Mori side in two wave attacks, both were repulsed.
sen.cmt: 織田氏の訳が「Odan clan」となっています。「兄の元続とともに」の兄の説明が欠けています。追加しました。原文は、基本的に「（毛利氏の家臣である南條氏の嫡子元清は小鴨氏の養子となり、南条氏と小鴨氏は親戚関係にあった）南条氏が織田氏へ離反→吉川（毛利）元春がこの離反に対抗し伯耆へ進出→元清等の反撃→元清の敗退」と解釈できます。wikipediaの本文には南條・小鴨両氏が吉川元春に従っていたと記述されていますがこの文章ではなぜか削除されています。長くならない程度に説明を加え、この文章だけで意味がわかるようにしました。
sen.e: In 1579, the Nanjo clan broke away from the Mori clan to the Oda clan, then Motoharu KIKKAWA (Motoharu MORI) opposed this action and invaded the Hoki province; although Motokiyo and his elder brother Mototsugu attacked Yabase-jo Castle of Mori side in two wave attacks, both were repulsed.

sen.j: その後の吉川氏との戦いにおいては、岩倉城 (伯耆国)を守り奮戦したが、天正10年（1582年）に羽衣石城が落城すると岩倉城を守っていた元清も元続と共に逃れた。
sen.e: Although he fought bravely in the later battle with the Kikkawa clan, in 1582 after the fall of Ueshi Castle, Motokiyo who was defending Iwakura Castle escaped along with Mototsugu.

Although he fought hard and bravely in those later battles with the Kikkawa clan, Motokiyo escaped along with Mototsugu after the fall of Ueshi-jo Castle in 1582 by leaving his defending castle Iwakura-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 城名の記述ですが、定訳でも「Iwakura-jo Castle」となっていたり「Ueshi Castle」となっておりルールがありません。「Iwakura-jo Castle」の形式で統一しました。
sen.e: Although he fought hard and bravely in those later battles with the Kikkawa clan, Motokiyo escaped along with Mototsugu after the fall of Ueshi-jo Castle in 1582 by leaving his defending castle Iwakura-jo Castle.

sen.j: 天正12年（1584年）に東伯耆へ復帰した後は病気がちになっていた元続の後見人となり、元続に代わり政務を担当した。
sen.e: After returning to Higashi Hoki, he became a guardian to the sickly Mototsugu and assumed the works of government affairs on his behalf.
After returning to Higashi Hoki in 1584, he became a guardian of the sickly Mototsugu and assumed the works of government affairs on his behalf.
sen.cmt: 「guardian to」「the sickly」のあいだのダブルスペースをシングルに修正しました。「天正12年-1584年」の訳が欠けています。追加しました。
sen.e: After returning to Higashi Hoki in 1584, he became a guardian of the sickly Mototsugu and assumed the works of government affairs on his behalf.

sen.j: 天正19年（1591年）に元続が死去し、南条元忠が家督を継ぐと元忠の後見人になり、打吹城番として城内の屋敷に住み政務を行った。
sen.e: After Mototsugu died in 1591, he assumed the works of government affairs as Uchifuki joban after becoming a guardian to Mototada who took over as head of the family by taking up a residency within the Castle compound.

After his elder brother Mototsugu died in 1591, his son Mototada NANJO succeeded the headship of Nanjo family; Motokiyo became the guardian of Mototada and assumed the works of government affairs as Utsubuki-jo Castle joban (live-in castle guardian) by residing in a residence within the castle compound.
sen.cmt: 分節の並び順が時間の流れなどの理解の際混乱をきたします。また関係代名詞を用いておりさらに分節が多くなっています。この点留意し修正しました。「打吹城番」の「打吹城」は「うちふきじょう」ではなく「うつぶきじょう」です。城番の解説を加えました。わかりやすくするため、多少追記し内容理解ができるようにしました。
sen.e: After his elder brother Mototsugu died in 1591, his son Mototada NANJO succeeded the headship of Nanjo family; Motokiyo became the guardian of Mototada and assumed the works of government affairs as Utsubuki-jo Castle joban (live-in castle guardian) by residing in a residence within the castle compound.

sen.j: （なお、この屋敷跡を「小鴨丸」という。
sen.e: The place was called "Ogamomaru" where his residence once stood.
The remain of his residence in this castle is now called "Ogamo-maru" (the walled territory area of Ogamo).
sen.cmt: 小鴨丸の解説を加えました。現在形に修正しました。
sen.e: The remain of his residence in this castle is now called "Ogamo-maru" (the walled territory area of Ogamo).

sen.j: ）朝鮮出兵の際には幼い元忠に代わり、自ら1500人の兵を率いて李氏朝鮮へ渡った。
sen.e: In a very young Mototada's place to dispatch troops to Korea, he accompanied 1500 soldiers to Korea's Yi Dynasty.
In the event of the invasion of Korean Peninsula during Yi Dynasty, Motokiyo himself led 1500 soldiers and crossed the sea in place of the young Mototada.
sen.cmt: 語順に問題があり訳文の意味があまり良く伝わりません。修正しました。
sen.e: In the event of the invasion of Korean Peninsula during Yi Dynasty, Motokiyo himself led 1500 soldiers and crossed the sea in place of the young Mototada.

sen.j: その後、後見人の座を巡る争いで元忠との確執が生じた元清は、山田越中守の進言で豊臣秀吉によって小西行長の下へ預けられ、この時「南条姓」に戻したという。
sen.e: When a feud over a guardian position erupted with Mototada, Motokiyo was placed under Yukinaga KONISHI's care by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI at the advice of Yamada Ecchu no kami (Governor of Eccho Province), and he went back to use "Nanjo surname" at this time.

When a feud over a guardian position erupted with Mototada, Motokiyo was placed under the care of Yukinaga KONISHI by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI upon the advice of Yamada Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province); he changed back to his original surname "Nanjo" at this time.
sen.cmt: andでつなぐべきものと分割すべきものを分けました。その他ケアレスミスなど含め修正しました。
sen.e: When a feud over a guardian position erupted with Mototada, Motokiyo was placed under the care of Yukinaga KONISHI by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI upon the advice of Yamada Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province); he changed back to his original surname "Nanjo" at this time.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いでは小西勢に属して加藤清正の隊と戦うが、戦後、小西家が没落すると6000石を以って加藤清正の家臣へ転じ、剃髪して「元宅」と名乗った。
sen.e: Although he fought for the Konishi clan against Kiyomasa KATO's troops during the Battle of Sekigahara, after the war he became a monk he became a monk to be called "Gentaku"when Konishi clan was fell and became a vassal and switched to serve Kiyomasa KATO for 6,000 koku.

Although he fought against the troops of Kiyomasa KATO under the Konishi troops during the Battle of Sekigahara, Motokiyo switched to serve under Kiyomasa KATO for 6,000 koku when the Konishi clan declined after the battle; he became a monk and called himself as "Gentaku."
sen.cmt: 時間経過などがつかめるよう修正・削除など多数行っています。
sen.e: Although he fought against the troops of Kiyomasa KATO under the Konishi troops during the Battle of Sekigahara, Motokiyo switched to serve under Kiyomasa KATO for 6,000 koku when the Konishi clan declined after the battle; he became a monk and called himself as "Gentaku."

sen.j: 慶長19年（1614年）、大坂の陣では豊臣秀頼に属す事を願い大阪へ向かうが、その船中で発病、建仁寺での療養の甲斐なく、同年2月13日 (旧暦)に死去した。
sen.e: In 1614, during the Siege of Osaka, he desired to serve Hideyori TOYOTOMI, hut he became ill during the voyage to Osaka and died on Februayr 13 of the same year despite the medical treatment received at Kennin-ji Temple.

Motokiyo wished to serve under Hideyori TOYOTOMI at the Siege of Osaka occurred in 1614, but he became ill during the voyage to Osaka, and died on March 23 of the same year despite the medical treatment received at Kennin-ji Temple.

Motokiyo wished to serve under Hideyori TOYOTOMI at the Siege of Osaka occurred in 1614, but he became ill during the voyage to Osaka, and died on March 23 of the same year despite the medical treatment received at Kennin-ji Temple.

sen.j: （10月23日説もあり）墓所は熊本市禅定寺にある。
sen.e: (There was report of October 23 also) His burial ground is located at Zenjou-ji Temple in Kumamoto City.
(There is also a theory to consider the date of his death as November 24) His grave is located at Zenjou-ji Temple in Kumamoto City.
sen.cmt: 原文に記載されていませんが、10月23日も旧暦と考え修正しました。墓所をburial groundからgraveに変更しました。
sen.e: (There is also a theory to consider the date of his death as November 24) His grave is located at Zenjou-ji Temple in Kumamoto City.

sen.j: 晩年に関する異説
sen.e: There was a heresy about his last years.
Heresy regarding his late years
sen.cmt: 文章ではないため、表現を修正しました。
sen.e: Heresy regarding his late years

sen.j: 元清の晩年に関しては諸説あり、前述した『南条氏盛衰記』に見える説もその諸説ある中のひとつである。
sen.e: There were various theories about his last years and the theory appearing in "Nanjo Seisui Ki" is one the theories that existed.
While there were various theories regarding his last years, the above-mentioned theory described in "Nanjo Seisui Ki" is one of those.
sen.cmt: one of theとするところ「one the theories」となっており前置詞of が欠けていますので修正しました。
sen.e: While there were various theories regarding his last years, the above-mentioned theory described in "Nanjo Seisui Ki" is one of those.

sen.j: このほか、『伯耆民談記』によれば元清は関ヶ原の後、美作国へ逃れ、その地で死亡したという。
sen.e: Furthermore, according to "Hoki Mindan Ki", Motokiyo died in Mimasaka Province where he escaped to after the Battle of Sekigahara.
According to "Hoki Mindan ki" (the folklores of Hoki), Motokiyo escaped to Mimasaka Province after the Battle of Sekigahara, and died in the place.
sen.cmt: 「このほか」を「Furthermore」としていますが、意味が異なるため、修正しました。時間経過が混乱しているのを修正しました。
sen.e: According to "Hoki Mindan ki" (the folklores of Hoki), Motokiyo escaped to Mimasaka Province after the Battle of Sekigahara, and died in the place.

sen.j: また、東京大学所蔵の「南条系図」によれば元清について「作州才原」に住むとしている。
sen.e: Also, according to "Nanjo family trees" owned by University of Tokyo, it indicates that Motokiyo lived in "Sasusaigenn".
According to another record "Nanjo family trees" owned by the University of Tokyo, Motokiyo resided in "Sakushu (another name of Mimasaka Province) Saibara."
sen.cmt: 作州才原を「Sasusaigenn」と訳していますが、「作州」は「さくしゅう」です。才原については特定できないため「さいばら」としました。
sen.e: According to another record "Nanjo family trees" owned by the University of Tokyo, Motokiyo resided in "Sakushu (another name of Mimasaka Province) Saibara."

sen.j: ただ、この説は後世に書かれた書物に見られるものであり、これを証明する確実な史料が存在するわけではない。
sen.e: However this theory is based on the literature written in much later a date and there is no supporting documents to substantiate it.
However, this theory is based on the books written in later years, and there is no substantiating historical records to prove its authenticity.
sen.cmt: 書物を「literature」としていますが「book」にしました。however後のコンマを追加しました。「in much later a date」は不定冠詞の使用が不適切です。
sen.e: However, this theory is based on the books written in later years, and there is no substantiating historical records to prove its authenticity.

sen.j: 一方で『南条氏盛衰記』説の方は傍証史料も存在しており、こちらの説の方が信憑性の度合いが高いといえる。
sen.e: On the other hand, there were historical materials existing to support "Nanjo clan Seisuiki" and this theory has a higher level of credibility.
On the other hand, there are historical materials to support the above-mentioned "Nanjo clan Seisuiki," thus it is considered this theory has a higher level of credibility.
sen.cmt: 現在存在するという意味ですので過去形を現在形にしました。
sen.e: On the other hand, there are historical materials to support the above-mentioned "Nanjo clan Seisuiki," thus it is considered this theory has a higher level of credibility.
